snippet: I visited here to celebrate my birthday. Despite not making any reservations, I easily got a table around 4 PM on a weekday without waiting. The seat I got was near the pizza oven, which made it uncomfortably hot and far from an enjoyable dining experience. I had the onion soup as a starter, which was delicious, especially the part baked with cheese on top. For the main course, I ordered two types of pasta. One of them was carbonara pasta with added shrimp, which I realized was an extra $50 when calculating the bill. While the shrimp was large and tasty, I couldn't help but think it would have been better if the server had mentioned the price when taking the order, considering it's quite expensive. The overall atmosphere of the restaurant is quite clean and stylishly presented. However, the staff seemed a bit indifferent, and I didn't find the service from the servers particularly good. It's a decent place to enjoy a casual meal or a date, but if you're looking for better service and taste, I wouldn't recommend it.

snippet:
Our first time to this place, and we realized we needed to have pizza when we saw their chefs tossing and baking handmade pizza in their pizza oven. We ordered their sausage, margherita & calabrese pizzas for 8 of us. They arrived with nicely crisped thin crusts. All of them were delicious! A couple in the group also had lasagne & short ribs, which they said was yummy. To accompany our main dinner, we ordered fried calamari, Caesar salad, arugula salad & brussel sprouts. We enjoyed them, but note that the brussel sprouts were not prepared whole, nor halved; rather, they were cut up & their layers then taken apart. Of all our dishes, this was our least favorite, as it tasted a bit burnt & bitter.

We must have arrived hangry, as we had a LOT of leftovers: about 1 - 1/2 pizzas & half the lasagne.  Their food is very tasty, but we suggest ordering 50% of the amount you think you want, or be prepared yo take lots of food home.

On the way out, we got a box of their mararons to share. They were light, fresh & a nice bite to end an evening of dining.
user.name: Lois Fong-Sakai

snippet:
Bottega Louie serves up a dichotomy of experiences, punctuated by an impeccable service that overshadows its seating plan, which, frankly, I found less charming. If you‚Äôre an early bird, be prepared for a brief intermission post-brunch service. The Margherita pizza is a high note ‚Äì a melody of fresh ingredients on a perfectly charred crust. It was, in many ways, harmonized by the attentive and commendable server we had ‚Äì truly a standout performance in the hospitality orchestra.

The cocktail offerings hit the right notes for an occasional drinker like myself, while the bread soloed as an unremarkable accompaniment. Dive into the salad, and you‚Äôll find an abundance of crab meat, which was a pleasant surprise, though a dash of corn could elevate the ensemble. Consistency was the theme, with each forkful delivering a reliable taste.

The chicken Parmesan, with its side of pasta, was the show‚Äôs headliner, thoroughly outshining my partner‚Äôs Trenne pasta, which seemed to lose its texture, resembling more of a chip than a symphony of flavors.

Portion sizes are generous, ensuring no curtain call on an empty stomach. However, despite the culinary crescendos, there‚Äôs no encore beckoning us back. Bottega Louie was a good act, but with the distance from our home stage, it‚Äôs uncertain if the performance was compelling enough for a repeat audience. In the end, Bottega Louie is like a solidly reviewed play ‚Äì you‚Äôre glad you saw it, but you don‚Äôt necessarily feel the pull to see it again.
user.name: Anthony's pocket Media

snippet:
I recently celebrated my birthday at your LA restaurant and while there were some positive aspects, overall, it wasn't the experience I had hoped for. Despite making a reservation well in advance, I was only able to secure a table for 10 pm, even though there were plenty of empty tables visible from the building across the street. I tried calling several times to see if I could get in earlier, but unfortunately, my calls went unanswered.

Upon arrival, I was pleased to be seated earlier than expected, which was a positive start. However, things took a downturn when we discovered that the appetizer we wanted was not available. Additionally, the wait for our pizza was exceptionally long, to the point where I had finished my main dish before it arrived. The lack of dessert options not being offered and the disappearing act of our waiter further added to the disappointment.

While I understand that every establishment can have off days, I had hoped for a more enjoyable birthday dinner. I appreciate the effort made to seat us earlier, but the overall experience fell short of my expectations. I believe there is room for improvement in terms of communication, menu availability, and attentive service.

Despite this experience, I remain hopeful that will take this feedback constructively and work towards providing a more consistent and memorable dining experience for their guests.

The broccolini was delicious, a simple dish that complimented the entree. The Brussels sprouts were excellent especially with the walnuts and sweetness brought in by the bleu cheese bite.

I sat the bar and the bartender was very knowledgeable about their menu items along with being very nice. I‚Äôd definitely come back again to try their other menu items. Parking is very limited to street or local garages, lots.

***update***
Just tried the following : Permesan broccolini soup, calamari friti, Napoli pizza & tiramisu.

The soup was descent but I wish there was a cup version. The flavor was great and little pieces of cheese, garlic were excellent. The calamari was delicious and the sauce was on point. Perfect crispness and flavor.

The pizza had perfectly baked crust & the toppings were balanced just right. An excellent pizza that they offer and the tiramisu was probably the best I‚Äôve had in a while.

snippet: Excellent food! We shared the bruschetta on focaccia bread. They provide 3 large pieces. As an appetizer it would easily serve 4 people. The dressing on the bruschetta paired very well with the tomatoes. The balsamic glaze and olive oil provided just the right amount of sweetness to the dish. I got the eggs Benedict which was one of the top 3 Benedict‚Äôs I‚Äôve had over the years. It is so hard to find a place that poaches the eggs correctly. Cooks very often overdo the eggs making the yolk overcooked. This was NOT the case here. Perfectly cooked. The ham pieces were generous, thick pieces, but again, not too thick. I‚Äôm not a fan of cooked spinach which was included in this version. However, it didn‚Äôt overpower the dish. It was NOT a drawback having the spinach and it did not affect my review. This is the second time we‚Äôve dined here in the last couple weeks. The first time the service was excellent. However, this time the service was a bit lacking. Our server was not bad, just disappeared for a long time when we were done, wanting our dishes to be removed and needed the check. Just a very slight hit on my review for this. My companion got the Carbonara which had freshly made pasta and an incredible taste. I‚Äôm going to get this next time we go. It is a bit pricey, too. For the two of us, both times was about $100. Whoa! The only thing I was disappointed with was the 5% ‚Äúsurcharge‚Äù. There was no explanation for this as to why it existed. Additionally, it was added prior to tax, so this 5% was a taxed surcharge. There is also no mention of this on the menu or anywhere else, it just shows up on the bill. Hey, Louie, get rid of this arbitrary cost and just add a dollar or two to each plate. This is why it‚Äôs a 4-star review and not 5-stars. Overall, it is an excellent restaurant and we will definitely return.

snippet:
I've been visiting this place for the last few months and was always amazed by the quality of the products. Unfortunately, I can't say the same about the service - more specifically, at the front counter where you buy macarons, cakes, and some other pastries.

The ladies over there are always unmotivated, distracted, hanging out, and treating you as if you were bothering them. Today, for example, after several attempts to get their attention while they were hanging out and having a laugh some guy (finally!) told them that I was there waiting to make an order. No apologies, no 'what can I do for you'; they just looked at me like saying 'what do you want?'. On top of that, I wanted to know the price of some stuffed pastries they had and one of the girls had a condescending attitude that was rude and unnecessary.

Unfortunately, these ladies are always like that: rude and completely careless. And it happens EVERY TIME I go. It's very disencouraging to find that kind of treatment in such a high-end place, with such high-quality products. If customer service is so uncaring, unfriendly, and unprofessional, you don't really want to go again no matter how good your sweets are.

I have to clarify that this negative review is ONLY for the ladies at the front counter: the ones selling the pastries, and the ones at the coffee area (your coffee can froze in time before they even bother to let you know that your drink is ready).

People at the bar and the restaurant are completely different: super nice, caring, and communicative. Or at least they act like they want to be there...

The ambiance was warm and inviting, with tasteful decorations that added to the overall appeal of the place. The menu, though concise, offered a carefully curated selection of dishes, ensuring that each item was prepared with the utmost attention to detail.

One dish that truly stood out was the tartufo pizza. Topped with egg and prosciutto, it was a delightful twist on the classic pizza, and the combination of flavors was simply divine. The richness of the prosciutto paired perfectly with the creamy egg, creating a unique and delicious blend that left me craving for more.

What I appreciated most about the restaurant was the focus on quality over quantity. Despite having a limited number of options on the menu, each dish was crafted with care and precision, showcasing the chef's culinary expertise. The staff was attentive and friendly, making the dining experience even more enjoyable.

The location of the restaurant was also a plus, conveniently located in a bustling area, making it a perfect spot for a casual lunch or a cozy dinner. While there are other dining options nearby, this restaurant truly stands out for its well-executed dishes and inviting atmosphere.

Overall, I had a fantastic dining experience, and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking a delightful culinary adventure in a beautiful setting.

As if the savory dishes weren't enough, the pastry selection at this restaurant is an absolute treat! After enjoying a satisfying lunch or dinner, indulging in their delectable pastries is a must. From decadent cakes to delicate pastries, their dessert menu offers a wide array of options to satisfy every sweet tooth. Each pastry is made with skill and passion, evident in every delightful bite. The combination of rich flavors and exquisite presentation makes for a truly memorable end to a wonderful dining experience. Whether you have a penchant for chocolate delights or prefer fruity tarts, their pastry selection has something to please every palate. It's safe to say that their pastries are nothing short of heavenly, and I highly recommend leaving some room for dessert to truly complete the dining journey at this exceptional restaurant.

snippet:
I've been wanting to visit here for a while. It's a great place to take new people in town for dessert. Food was good, not great. I had smoked salmon benedict. Salmon tasted very fresh and tasty. Benedict was on hash brown which was a little weird for me. I definitely like it better with biscuit or english muffin. My friend ordered margarita pizza. It was mediocre. Coffee was served cold. Our server barely attended us. I had to call someone else for coffee refill as well. Service wasn't good, but it was too busy of a place to expect much.
Dessert selection is great. I got their tiramisu for my husband and it was one of the best he ever had. Desserts are worth it, but on a very expensive side. A small slide of tiramisu was $15, so was a mini fruit tart.

I would go back if I had to take tourist friends or family.

Parking is difficult, but there's a public parking across the restaurant for $7.
user.name: Century S

snippet:
We were lucky to get seated immediately after showing up on a fairly busy Sat during the USC graduation and Mother's Day weekend. I couldn't make reservations online so I assume they didn't have a reservation system.

When you walk in, you get a full view of their bakery section, the delicious macarons and pasties on the right and the open view kitchen on the left. The whole place has a relaxed, modern and fancy-casual feel. It is definitely loud, thanks to the open layout. So you do have to scream into people's ears. The service was very nice but could've been a little more prompt.

We ordered plates to share so we all tasted a bit of everything - the lobster hash, the smoked salmon Benedict, the calamari fritti and the Louis salad. I got an iced matcha green tea latte which was very very good for a matcha lover.

The smoked salmon Benedict was the best of all the food. The salmon had a slight tarty-spicy kick to it which I enjoyed. The hash cake it lay on was also delicious. The hollandaise was well done as was the poached egg. All in all, great recipe.

The lobster hash sounded much better than it was. The hash was delicious. The lobster could've had a little more salt or spice to it as it was pretty bland. The sauce it came in was too liquid and had a yolky taste to it which I didn't particularly love. Some of the greens accompanying the dish were also little bitter for my taste buds. So, a dish that sounded tastier than it was.

The calamari was as expected. Nothing too fancy, nothing too out of the ordinary. It was a nice accompaniment as a smaller plate with 3 other big plates.

The Louis salad was delicious! As a rule, I don't order salads because I don't consider it a full meal. But this salad was a tasty medley of greens, crab, avocadoes and a dressing that got my taste buds singing. It was also a huge portion! Among the four of us, we had a hard time finishing everything.

As a dessert, we first ordered the almond pistachio cherry pastry which deserves an entire star in itself. It looked so so perfect and, if it is even possible, tasted better than it looked! The pistachio jaconde cake was moist and light, the cherry marmalade was perfectly sweet and firm and the almond and pistachio mousse was so so tasty. We cleaned that up!

We then also ordered a limonchello which was a tarty tart with a limonchello curd and limonchello cloud with pralines. Now, as a rule, I'm one of those tart-loving people who complain "not enough lemon, needs more lime..." Well, ladies and gentlemen, not this time! This was so so tarty and just the right level of sweet that I couldn't get enough of it! The tart itself was a little firm and we were so full, I only licked off all the limoncello curd and the cloud. I'm not a fan of pralines, especially when they interfere with my soul-calming experience with limonchello or lemon or lime tartness. So maybe they should get rid of the pralines.

All in all, the food is good but those pastries blew out minds. Come here for the pastries. I wish I could've tried the macarons but we were so full that we could not. So next time it is!

snippet:
Bottega Louie is a culinary treasure nestled in the heart of downtown LA, and my recent visit left me utterly delighted. This French bakery and restaurant is a true gem.The matcha croissant was a revelation. It was a delightful twist on a classic, and I couldn't get enough.The egg benedicts were nothing short of amazing. It was a symphony of taste and presentation that made brunch a memorable affair.But it's not just the food that makes Bottega Louie exceptional. The ambiance is equally charming, with its elegant, European-inspired decor and bustling atmosphere.

The attentive staff adds to the overall experience, making you feel like a cherished guest.Bottega Louie is more than a restaurant; it's an experience. Whether you're indulging in their inventive pastries or savoring the classic brunch offerings, each visit is a culinary journey worth taking. If you find yourself in downtown LA, don't miss the opportunity to dine at Bottega Louie; it's a gastronomic delight you won't want to miss.

snippet:
Bottega Louie
Downtown Los Angeles

This bustling and vibrant restaurant is a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a consistently delicious dining experience.

The moment you step through the doors, you‚Äôre greeted by an eye-catching array of colorful pastries and a warm, inviting atmosphere. Bottega Louie‚Äôs tastefully designed interior, featuring high ceilings and grand windows, perfectly complements its exquisite menu offerings.

Diners are treated to a versatile selection of impeccably prepared dishes, with each bite guaranteed to satisfy even the most discerning palates. From their signature pizzas, cooked to perfection in a wood-fired oven, to the mouthwatering pasta dishes that transport you straight to the heart of Italy, Bottega Louie consistently delivers on taste and quality.

In summary, Bottega Louie is an unmissable culinary experience in downtown Los Angeles, providing consistently scrumptious food in a chic and sophisticated setting. A true delight for the senses, this enchanting eatery is sure to leave a lasting impression on your taste buds.

snippet:
As a cookbook author,  I always appreciate good food, but a cute upscale ambience never hurts. If the glass display of macarons and other delectable pastries just inside the door  doesn't entice you in, then you don't have a sweet tooth. But Bottega Louie delivers on the savory food also. We started with the Brussels sprouts and Walnuts which were absolutely delicious.  Crispy and flavorful.  Then we shared a plate of arancini. The rice balls had a nice subtle herbaceous flavor. The pizza arrived and was super thin crust with just the right amount of toppings. In this case prosciutto and burrata. Everything was delicious and expertly served. Our waiter was knowledgeable and friendly. But lunch wouldn't have been complete without something sweet. I highly recommend the hazelnut beignet. Purely and utterly  blissful. But the macarons are also hard to beat.  I can't wait to go back.

Lisa Steele
Author of The Fresh Eggs Daily Cookbook
user.name: Lisa Steele l Fresh Eggs Daily

snippet: Incredible food, cool ambiance, professional, helpful staff. I've only been here for breakfast so far, but the food impressed me and the waiter got me drunk with his drink recommendations. snippet: So, I've heard rave reviews about this place And I was working in the area so I decided to finally give it a shot for lunch. I called ahead to make sure lunch reservations weren't required, and they weren't. I spoke to a really nice woman on the phone also named Michelle and we had a brief conversation about her favorite food items that I should eat. I walked inside and was quickly seated. They brought water immediately and placed the piece of bread in the center of my small table. I ordered the "Calabrese" Pizza by recommendation and since I'm pescatarian, ordered it with no salami. I also ordered the gazpacho. The bread was good, however it wasn't warm like I thought it would be and the butter was refrigerated, so really hard to spread. I asked my waitress for some soft butter and she brought some back in no time! I was still kind of sad the bread wasn't warm but I got over that pretty quickly when the gazpacho arrived. They placed a large white bowl in front of me with flowers and herbs on the side and a man with what looked like a wine decanter poured the gazpacho into the bowl. It was a very cool experience and the gazpacho was absolutely delicious. The pizza blew me away way more than I thought it was going to. The spicy with the mixture of the honey drizzle on top was absolute perfection. The best part about lunch by myself here, having plenty of leftovers for later. I look forward to coming back and will update if my experience exceeds my expectations.

This is a review of the restaurant, not the bakery or bar. We arrived slightly before the lunch crowd but by the time we finished at noon it  was impossible to hear each other, leading the weak wag among us to dream up a joke:

Q: What is the most common word spoken in Bottega Louie?
A: What?
Q: Oh, you've heard this already

UPDATE: went for my first breakfast there and the food was all very good. I have the Crab Louie salad even though I wanted the croque madam. The Portobello sticks were fantastic! After a very nice lunch with friends the bill came and it was $410 and we're about to pay it until somebody noticed that waffles and mimosas were on and none of us have had those. We looked more closely and found some other items that have been at it, like somebody else's Bill had been merged with ours. The dacquoise itself is excellent but the Chantilly cream is not that great. I prefer if it was the fruits on the dacquoise without the cream. Also for any dessert with a cr√®me au beurre, the quantity is too much making it heavy. Need to reduce the sugar and butter quantities.

snippet:
My seat mate on the flight over to LAX said to me "If you want a bougie brunch, you HAVE to go to Bottega Louie", so that's what we did. It did NOT disappoint. All the servers were extremely attentive, and accommodating. The food was absolutely, supremely good. The smoked salmon benedict was, in a word, perfect. The poached eggs were extremely fresh, the Hollandaise was clearly prepared that morning and had a lovely creamy mouth feel that complimented the poached runny yolk. The decision to top the eggs over potato pancakes was a great idea.

Bougie or not, this place is definitely worth the visit. I'd suggest going early to avoid the late brunch rush, however, as this popular destination fills up quickly.

The beignet‚Äôs melt in your mouth that topped off my beautiful breakfast ‚ô•Ô∏è I am definitely stopping in to pick up some items to bring back to My Chi-Town Family!! Before the end of my trip!!

snippet:
Scroumpousness in one bite! The macaroons are..."to live for." You must at least once...splurge-a-bit! Louie's worth it. You feel like you've been SOMEPLACE very very special.
When you're downtown L. A., you owe it to yourself this "experience." If we eat with our eyes...(and we do) this place is a variable feast.
You enter marble halls...pass the vibrantly colored fresh macaroons (to gold leafed chocolates that rivaled Europe's best)...pass the open pizza kitchen (if you can) to the back tables for FOOD.
The restrooms are a must see they are so beautifully done.
It's like being "transported" to France, just walking off the street.
Waiter was delightful. Messed up the order...but totally made up for it!
We left with boxes of assorted fresh macaroons and gold chocolates and some other concoctions that were delicious. Each bite at home brought back memories of an evening well spent...first The Ahmanson Theater's production of The Temptations and then dinner and DESERT(S) at Bottega Louie.
On my top 10 Best Dessert Restaurants List! ‚ô°

snippet: I've come to this place a few times since I first ate here roughly 10 years ago. I can't come here very often, I'm not in Los Angeles that often, but when I am, I make sure I stop by for lunch or dinner. I've brought my girlfriend here before, and most recently, a friend from out of state. One thing has struck me about this place. The consistency of a delicious meal. It's never failed to deliver. Salads, apps, pizzas, you name it. I shared calamari and meatballs with friends as we waited for our pizza to share. The calamari, I'm picky. I'm not the biggest fan of seafood, but will definitely appreciate when it's well done. I loved it here, definitely one of the best I've had. Meatballs, not everyone can make them well. These were seasoned well, slightly crispy on the outside and great center. The pizza, perfect. What can I say, a good pizza can be hard to find. They're everywhere, but they're not ALL good. Made right in front of you, a great, thin, delicious pie. Excellent sauce. I'll definitely continue to come back for years to come.

snippet:
Beautiful restaurant but the music was a little loud. They don't take reservations so we called to see how long the wait would be, and the person on the phone wouldn't even say if there was currently a line. (We almost decided not to go.)

We only waited 20 mins. The service was quick and very good. Many of the staff were no longer wearing masks (which was a first).

Overall the food was good. I have never seen portobello fries, and they were really tasty. The portion is large and easily shared. I would definitely get those again. I was less fond of the avocado sandwich. The bread was really thick, and there was a strange taste to the avocado.

My friend had the club sandwich, and we both agreed that was the winner. The portions are smaller than a normal club, and the percentage of bread to filling was perfect. It came with fries that were also good.

We didn't order dessert, but what they offer looked amazing!

Next time, I would definitely get a pizza or their pasta dishes. They also looked incredible!
user.name: Kevin Gardner

snippet: OMG! If you are ever in downtown Los Angeles and want a fabulous place for breakfast or a place to stop for an amazing dessert this is the place to go. I wish I had gone the night before so I could have indulged in another dessert. I had the Smoked Salmon Benedict for breakfast and it was made to perfection. It was a toss up between that and the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes (I'll be having those on my next visit) but since I had decided to take tartettes to go I went with the Benedict. The tartlets by the way Amazing and I cannot empathize the word amazing enough. Super glad I found this gem, it is now a must visit on all future trips to LA! Judging by the amazing options on their menu I'll be planning a number of visits! Thank you to all the staff for a great first experience.

snippet:
If you want fancy desserts in at a fancy place, Bottega Louie is the place for you.
The interior is absolutely amazing. White marble everywhere, everything is clean, and the staff are very professional and friendly. During my time there, I noticed the cleaning crew constantly wiping the windows that displayed the food and sweeping anything visible off the floor. Insane.
If you're coming just for desserts, the only downside is that your seating is limited to the small tables in the cocktail area vs the large tables in the dining area. While it's not a big deal if it's just you and your date, it can feel a bit cramped if your party is any bigger.
The desserts are pretty good too! My girlfriend and I got the tiramisu cake and 5 macarons. We really enjoyed everything, but what really sets Bottega apart is their packaging. When I opened the boxes, it felt like I was opening a new iPhone.
It's definitely pricey, but I would recommend any of their cakes.

snippet:
I had the pleasure of dining at Bottega Louie in downtown Los Angeles, and overall, it was a delightful experience. The restaurant's chic and elegant atmosphere immediately caught my attention as I entered. The stylish decor and lively ambiance created a great setting for a memorable evening.

Now, onto the pepperoni pizza. The pizza was definitely a highlight of the meal. The thin crust had a lovely crispiness, and the cheese was gooey and satisfying. The pepperoni provided a nice kick of flavor and added a satisfying savory element to each bite. While the flavors were enjoyable and the pizza was well-executed, I felt that it didn't quite reach the level of being exceptional or unique.

The service at Bottega Louie was attentive and courteous, and the staff was more than happy to assist with any inquiries or requests. Although the timing of some dishes was a tad inconsistent, it didn't significantly impact the overall dining experience.

One aspect that stood out was the variety of options available on their menu. Beyond the pizza, there were a range of dishes that showcased the restaurant's commitment to quality ingredients and creative preparation. It's clear that the culinary team takes pride in crafting a diverse selection for diners to choose from.

While my experience was positive, I would have liked to see a bit more innovation in the pizza's flavor profile to truly make it stand out. Nevertheless, Bottega Louie is a restaurant worth visiting for its inviting ambiance, friendly service, and an array of appealing dishes. I'll certainly consider returning to explore more of their offerings.

One of two of my favorite restaurants in the entire city and perhaps the US. I found Bottega Louie Restaurant and Gourmet Market 4 years ago on my first trip to LA.

I love, love, love this place. It's a simple white decor and the food is exceptional. The pastry shop is none other I've experienced. Today they measured up with a smoked salmon eggs benedict. I have eaten a lot of eggs benedict and I am going on record as saying this was the BEST I've ever eaten. The differentiating factor, other than the smoked salmon, was it was served on a small bed of shredded potatoes and not the typical English muffin. This was perfection!

The only downside is the noise (they could use some acoustic tiles; 74dD at 10:30am). I came here for dinner 2 years ago and my ears were ringing when we left. Hazards of marble floors, square walls and ceilings and wood and leather furnishings; nothing to absorb sound.

snippet:
Bottega Louie is a must-visit restaurant and patisserie in Downtown LA, and it's no surprise why it's a favorite among locals and visitors alike. The moment you step inside, you're greeted with a beautiful and elegant interior that perfectly blends simplicity and sophistication. The ambiance is inviting and comfortable, making it a perfect place to dine alone or with friends.
The staff is exceptional, always friendly, and attentive, making you feel welcome and appreciated.
If you're a fan of croissants and baguettes, then you're in for a real treat at Bottega Louie. They serve some of the most delicious pastries that you'll find in LA. Their whole Italian menu is great, burger and onion soup are standout dishes, and their salads are fresh, crisp, and full of flavor.
But the real star of Bottega Louie is their French desserts. The presentation and taste of each dessert are extraordinary, and you'll find yourself taking pictures of them before you indulge. And to top it off, their packaging is beautifully designed, making them perfect gifts for any occasion.
Bottega Louie is my go-to place for a quick meal or celebratory dinners with friends. It's the perfect spot for any time of day, and I'm always satisfied with my experience. I'm going to miss it dearly when I'm in France for the next four months, as I know I won't find better croissants and baguettes than the ones at Bottega Louie.
I highly recommend Bottega Louie for anyone looking for a fantastic dining experience in DTLA. From the delicious food to the exceptional staff and beautiful ambiance, it's a true gem of a restaurant and patisserie.
user.name: Aggie Cooke

snippet:
Mr. Porter, not only is this review for the outstanding staff service, flavorful dishes and atmosphere but it‚Äôs for Mimi, Pablo and Elizabeth at the LA location. Elizabeth greeted us and sat us immediately to our table. Such a pleasant smile on your Hostess. Our server was Pablo, he was extremely knowledgeable in the menu, especially by describing which wine my pallet was craving, based on my typical preferences. He brought me the right amount of two tastings and the recommended choice by Pablo was the bottle selected!! I couldn‚Äôt let a drop of the wine go, I normally do not consume as so but we stayed for quite sometime so I enjoy every drop. Prior to ordering any food, he asked if there were any allergies. It was caring and wonderful because I always have to advise of my allergy‚Ä¶I‚Äôm almost never asked. He also recommended the Portabella parmesan fries as an appetizer. WOW PERFECTION! I didn‚Äôt even take a picture, that‚Äôs how fast they were eaten! Pablo checked on us a perfect amount. Rib eye flavor was absolutely amazing. I enjoyed the B√©arnaise sauce..very tasty in my opinion. The piercing fresh flavors of the Lasagna was impeccable. The bread, I could eat those things at every meal, served warm with butter. Mimi popped over a few times as well and I see why she is apart of Bottega Louie. She is the exact elegance Bottega Louie embodies. Bravo!! Mimi recommended a dessert because I simply couldn‚Äôt choose and again winner there! The raspberry macaron, such a light but delicious delight to end the evening!! Ok now for the rest, the table set up is fantastic, the atmosphere is nice variety but pleasant. Mixed casual, tourist, professional and business patrons. The kitchen is visual upon walking in and was absolutely amazing, clean, and as far as I could see well managed! Larger party tables are an option. There is a dessert bar for To-go orders and a quaint bar as well; awesome touch there. Also there is a Pizza oven area I‚Äôm extremely curious about. I do recommend making a reservation in advance to ensure availability. They also have a Weekend Brunch menu (definitely will be checked out). Go online and take a look at the menu options if you‚Äôve never been to either location; West Hollywood and LA. All common forms of payment accepted. Valet at this location is the way to go for parking ($18 cash/card/tap pay), but there is surrounding parking if preferred instead. Since this location is in the heart of LA, there is on site Private armed or even unarmed Officer, subtle, but classy! Not in your face like most Private Protection companies. This is a grand effort to provide comfort in dining because of course the work is unpredictable. I truly feel that having safety present, sets Bottega Louie superbly aside from the surrounding establishments. Phenomenal experience‚Ä¶might be the new monthly date night location ; ) it was amazing. Can‚Äôt wait to explore the rest of Bottega Louie!
-Mrs. A. Valdez

snippet: I‚Äôve been picking up their scrumptious baked goods for months and eating inside the West Hollywood Bottega since it opened, particularly for special occasions. My one criticism involves the restaurant‚Äôs inexplicable decision to stick a non-edible square of cardboard in the top of the pastries. With edible gold leaf next to it, it‚Äôs  easy to assume that the cardboard is edible as well, and its unpleasant taste momentarily takes away from enjoying the rest. If Bottega Louie truly feels that its patrons need to be reminded of where their goodies were purchased, the pastry chef there should create a duplicate of that cardboard logo in a material that won‚Äôt need to be spit out by the diner who doesn‚Äôt recognize it for what it is. There is also the issue of children and people who are unused to eating decorated pastries choking on the cardboard. This is such an easy fix that I can‚Äôt believe it hasn‚Äôt already been addressed, but somebody there needs to do so in order to make the experience of eating there close to perfection.
user.name: Jeffrey Rockwell

snippet:
One of the loveliest places in DTLA. Bottega Louie is one of my favorite places in the area as well as my friends. This place just screams lovely!

The pastries and cakes are a definite must but the menu is just as delicious. I am a big fan of their Mache salad as it is light, fresh and full of wonderful flavors. It also gives you enough room for dessert which I highly recommend!

On my most recent visit, my server was Jerry and he was an absolute gem! After finishing my salad, he asked if I wanted dessert. Naturally I said yes but instead of him going over all the lovely sweets they offered, I asked him to pick one out for me. "Surprise me!", I said. He picked out the perfect dessert to finish off my Mache Salad. I was brought the Limoncello cake which was citrusy, light and wonderful. He said that I seemed like a Limoncello type of lady and I took that as a compliment!

I will always keep coming back to Bottega Louie for their Mache salad and pastries. I am sure you will love this place too and hopefully you will have the same server. He picks out the perfect desserts!

Waiter brings the pizza that has a sunny side up egg in the middle and he broke the yolk for us and drizzled it all over the pizza beautifully. For dessert we ordered a lemon cheesecake and blueberry shooter ($11) and the gold pieces on it made it so fancy and pretty.

This spot is definitely worth it even with the prices being a little high for their burger and stuff but once you see the sizes and flavors.....you'll be happy you made the trip and you will plan the next<3

There's menus on the table and someone will usually come serve you. But if you want the full experience, I suggest you walk over to the hostess to be seated in the actual dining area. Sitting next to the pizza station is a lot fun because occasionally they throw the dough in the air, so it's entertaining to see. However when its busy they are more focused on getting the food out. snippet:
A spectacular place! One of the gems in downtown Los Angeles.

I‚Äôve visited Bottega Louie a few times and have never been disappointed! The ambience is classy and ultra clean; the staff is super friendly and attentive; the food is amazing; and it‚Äôs actually more of a casual place than its appearance would have you believe. So don‚Äôt be afraid to go!

Very reasonably priced. I thoroughly enjoy their pizzas. Their appetizers are wonderful too, especially the calamari! And oh my goodness, the desserts are to die for. There‚Äôs even a whole pastry display/dessert bar inside if you want to take home another slice of cake or some macaroons (of which, the selections are endless).

My only complaint about this place is the acoustics. It gets loud when the place is full and is amplified because of the tall ceiling and tiles. So, conversation at a table can be difficult to engage in. But this is hardly a complaint.

I love this place, and it‚Äôs a must if you‚Äôre in town! I‚Äôm super excited that they‚Äôre opening a location in West Hollywood, as that‚Äôs closer to where I live, and I can definitely see myself visiting there often!

Parking is.... well..... challenging. There‚Äôs a cheap garage nearby across from the Ross Dress For Less on Broadway... but there‚Äôs also metered parking around. I don‚Äôt believe there‚Äôs valet, but I could be wrong. Easily accessible and within walking distance of most of DTLA‚Äôs main attractions!

ENJOY!

The portions aren't usually very large for the price you feel like you still need to get more food or perhaps that's their way of ensuring you have dessert! Their drinks are well made and delicious. The coffee in the morning is delicious and they make their own simple syrup. The macaroons are what they're well known for and they are in fact delicious and their price is equivalent to anywhere else I've gone. I've also had many of their other desserts and every single one is outstanding and in my opinion the best part about this place. I prefer to skip dinner and just go there for dessert. snippet:
If you ever find yourself near Grand Ave in LA you should think about stopping in to try some Bottega Louie.

They truly offer a great take on all classic Italian dishes.   Only negative is pricing but last I checked most nice places cost money in LA.  So expensive here lol.   Normally I'd give 3 stars with good food and higher prices but the friendly wait staff and atmosphere made me give 4.   My waiter Mario (I think that was his name) was a gem.   Very attentive to all of our needs and was tipped nicely because of it.

The food is amazing.  You can taste they use quality ingredients and they're always fresh and it shows in the taste.   From their pizza to classic Italian dishes I can say I've never been disappointed with their menu and food.  Will not disappoint.
user.name: Barbara Chen

snippet: This was a very interesting place. It felt like I was in a giant cafeteria with 30-40 waiters/waitresses prancing around. Very big OPEN concept and super loud. Food is pretty pricey here but it tasted fine. I liked going the one time for the experience but won't probably go back.  It's pretty much the exact opposite of an "intimate" restaurant.
user.name: Bryan

snippet: The pastries and desserts are to die for. Now the place is kind of loud and the staff was in a hurry to kick us out to get more customers. They even took my half-eaten main course.
user.name: Claudia MdO

snippet:
Lobster hash was amazing. Croque Monsieur came with a sadly overcooked egg sunnyside up (hard yoke, no bueno). Beniets were a puffy bread lump, i.e
boring donut, rolled in sugar, probably the biggest disappointment after seeing all the other amazing looking pastries...should have had a croissant instead. Charming service and great company made up for the food's lack. Will be back for pastries for sure.
user.name: Jon Bush

snippet: I really had to try this place with so many raving reviews. The atmosphere itself was an experience with the lively energy from all the people surrounded by so many beautiful desserts, delicately crafted food, and lovely decor. There was a 20-30 min wait to get seated but worth it. The lobster hash with fresh lobster on top of a bed of potatoes along with perfectly smooth eggs is a must try. Wonderful flavors!
user.name: Kim Nguyen

snippet: If you can't hear yourself for several hours eating here  that would be understandable. The nosiest place I have been in a very long time. The clientele is touristy. Totally different feel from when it first opened. Food is nothing to rave about. Past its prime thats for sure
user.name: Laurette Healey

snippet:
Elegant, cool and stylish... a place that will change your mood no matter what... life time experience.
I really would love to meet the person behind this... such taste and perfection in every corner... what a vision.
We were in LA three days..  and ate here at least once every day... it brought peace and joy to our heart and Tommy.
The service is warm and charming... on one of our visits, we were surprised with a complimentary box of sweets.
I believe this place goes beyond food... it is a landmark and must see when in LA.
user.name: Mued Hamad

snippet: An outstanding Lemon Drop! üçã Will definitely return!  Don't forget to try the pastries.
user.name: Maria Rodriguez

snippet: Great food, and very good service.  The Lasagna is wonderful.   The chicken parmigiano also wonderful.  The pasta tastes like homemade - so darn good.  The atmosphere is a little loud, but the space is very large so table conversation is good.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone coming to the downtown area.
user.name: Eric Kurth

snippet:
This restaurant is beautiful! No reservations but they said its not needed as their space is big enough to seat everyone within 15-20 minutes. From the times I've been there, I found this to be accurate.

My favorites aren't the entree but the desserts!! Especially the chocolate souffle for $15. I order just appetizers as my entree just so I can enjoy the souffle at the end of my meal.
user.name: francesca sadikin

snippet: Very pretty and elegant inside. I didn‚Äôt eat at the cafe but got some treats at the bakery end. The raspberry cake was amazing, the macaroons where very good, even the sugar donuts they tried to pass off as Beignets where very good. It‚Äôs a bit expensive. Macaroons where $2.50 each and the sugar donuts where $3-3.50 and the small cake was $14. A fun place to go tho if you‚Äôre in the area
user.name: Oo ‚ÄúHotchipsNDip‚Äù oO

snippet: Enjoyed our dinner and drinks here. Food were mostly good. I enjoyed fried calamari and ribeye steak. Scallops were cooked well. However, I didn't care for the overall flavor of the dish. Very good services. It was a bit pricey and noisy.
user.name: Sunny Roland

snippet: Wow, this place astounding. We were a group of office mates and shared a pizza and various brunch items for our party of six, and every dish was better than the other. I ate a lot with every bite being a delight, we then checked out the desserts which were on another level. LA is known for its incredible food, and I made sure to eat in as many different places as possible but this one was THE BEST by far. The service was exceptional as well, hands down one of the best restaurants I have been to and that this place is in downtown LA just a few minutes from Staples center makes it too good.
user.name: Ajay Vidyasagar

snippet: While on a work trip to LA this past week, I was lucky enough to be able to get a hotel within walking distance of Bottega Louie. I had never heard of this establishment before coming to LA, but after a bit of research it seemed to be that this was an LA staple.  This is a restaurant that sells baked goods as well.  The place is usually packed during lunch and dinner hours. They have a large wine selection, pizzas, pastas and other menu items. The lunch crowd is a bit casual, but if you are dining there for dinner in the restaurant the ambiance is quite romantic. The table settings are beautiful and you can see the chefs preparing meals behind the glass window.  A separate section of the restaurant sells baked good such as exquisite little cakes of all different varieties and decorated nicely. Macaroons seem to be their specially as they seems to have many different flavors that you can purchase to eat there or have wrapped up in a gift box. They also sell bottles of wine, olive oil and some of the best chocolates.  This place does come with a price tag. 13 macaroons will run you about $37. But if you want the experience and have the money, pay this place a visit.
user.name: Anita Shah

snippet: Bottega Louie is a decent spot and is vegetarian friendly. It isn't my favorite place in town, but pizzas and desserts here are pretty good. The atmosphere is pretty noisy but I really enjoyed the vaulted ceilings at this place. Waiters were fast and courteous. Overall, I wouldn't seek this place out but if I were in the neighborhood or looking for a place to take a date, I'd consider it but overall it is over-rated.
user.name: Nima Motamedi

snippet: The food was amazing. We were in a nice corner. The server was attentive. But when it came time to bring small requested items we had to ask for times and each time she forgot. Then when it came time to request a second cocktail she forgot and brought us the bill. We were quite disappointed in the service from our particular server but the overall experience was nice. I‚Äôm not going to rate this a 5 due to our server otherwise I would give it 5. Food is fabulous. Forgo the caprese it was just ok.
user.name: ted taylor

snippet: Hands down one of the best atmospheres in all of Los Angeles. This restaurant is beautiful the service is always impeccable. The food is pretty good but the Ambiance is on another level. You feel like you were at one of the top restaurants in the world. Every time I go here I am blown away by the service that the waiters give they make everyone feel extremely special.
user.name: Nima

snippet: The best patisserie I have ever been to! There is always a line to be seated but they take good care of you till then. There is a bar where you get cocktails and the waiters will find you when you get your seat. The grilled salmon and shrimp was what I had song with sliders. And a lot of pastries. Amazing place ever
user.name: Sujal Mungekar

snippet:
Being half Italian I feel I can spot a great Italian meal right when I taste it so after stopping in for Valentines dinner tonight I can say that this is delicious food and nothing like so many of the non authentic Italian restaurant chains all around the US. They have a great selection of desserts and many will be stopping in for those, but the restaurant service is the real best part. They don‚Äôt take reservations, nor can you put your name on a waitlist digitally like they say they can do on their VM, but still we only waited 25 minutes tonight and it was worth it.

I had to get an Italian Soda to drink with my meal because they have been something that I have loved since childhood but rarely see anymore, so if you‚Äôre in the mood for something sweet I would highly recommend ordering one.  For the food we ordered the Carpaccio to start and it was very good and for $18 it was a fair price.  For our entrees we got the Carbonara (which was my favorite) and the Burrata pizza.  I can say the pizza is the best that I‚Äôve had in DTLA, Pizzanista is my other favorite, I was pleasantly surprised how good it was. It had crisped garlic on top and they went above by cooking the spinach before adding it to the pizza which is the authentic way and sadly many other places don‚Äôt focus on the smaller details as well.

Overall a casual and delicious meal. It‚Äôs priced fairly and can get very busy depending on the day and time so I would be prepared to wait around a half an hour to be seated. I will be back again soon.
user.name: Zan Lee

snippet:
It was beautiful, gold and white marble all over! Such a luxurious area and the desserts are beautifully and deliciously made!
Come visit this place when you come to LA! Sad that I wasnt able to take pics but you wont regret it!
user.name: Shiela Grace Gonzales

snippet: Expensive but worth a special occasion! The pizza is soooo good! The souffle pancake was the best I‚Äôve EVER had. The chocolate souffl√© is to DIE FOR! The risotto balls are amazing. Everything I‚Äôve had here has been incredible and it‚Äôs a really cute restaurant in general. Highly recommend.
user.name: Mari P

snippet: I‚Äôve tried a number of their cake and tarte options, and they range from pretty good to excellent. some of them are kind of hard and dry which I guess is required to get a certain look? I don‚Äôt believe in sacrificing flavor or texture for aesthetics. the prices are very high and in line with the high end feel of the place and beautiful interior and pretty pastries, but for as much as you‚Äôre paying some of them kind of disappoint when you actually take a bite. the one pastry I do really like here and would come back for us the hazelnut crunch. really the best thing about this place is the interior, a place to take someone to or to gift but if you just want delicious pastries, there are better options.
user.name: Anna Ushakova

snippet: I came here with my girlfriend for our 2 year anniversary and we had a wonderful time! They gave us privacy, the food was absolutely exquisite, and our server was a complete professional. We've raved many times over the food we had that night and can't wait to go back! ....Also, if you have a sweet tooth, their dessert bar is DELICIOUS!
user.name: Grant Powell

snippet:
There is a huge amount of people during brunch, I had to wait 20 minutes to get a seat. The place is beautiful, but it was very loud because of a lot of people. Once I sat down, I ordered a green juice and a sausage pizza. The green juice took a bit of time.

Green juice was a little bland, it could use some pineapple in it. Adding some orange juice to the green juice helped it a little though.

The pizza took super long. When it came, I ate it. It was super good and the pizza looked and tasted authentic. Tomato sauce was very good, and they did not load it with cheese. Perfect!

Overall, I really love the food, but I never waited so long in a restaurant before.
user.name: Diego Mejia

snippet: Great service but a long wait before you would get your food and the description on the menu items is not very clear. We ordered something that did not taste good at all , It was some sort of beef with Fried Pasta and the worse thing we ever tasted and we notified our server who just ignored it.
user.name: khurram iqbal

snippet: Delicious meals, fresh ingredients, great service!
user.name: Jim Brule

snippet: Best pastries in Los Angeles. Known for their macarons.
user.name: Eddie Vasquez

snippet: Usually come for their dessert bar and this place gets packed üòÅ. So the meal I got is a potato pancake with prosciutto. Dang I didn't think I get a happy amount too, yeah the meal may look small comparing other dishes but this is heavy in the good way. Not many know how to make good potato pancakes keeping soft inside and crispy outside. Great option if you have an egg sensitivity.
user.name: Gwen Fred

snippet: Bottega Louie is one of my favorite restaurants in America. I was fortunate enough to live just two blocks away for a couple years and in all of my experiences with Bottega Louie, I have never had anything negative. The service is impeccable. I mean, the staff actually addresses you by name and the prices are actually really reasonable. Whether you sit down to dine or avoid the line and order up front, the food is incredible. Everything that I have ever tasted has been perfect. If you're on a budget, I recommend splitting a pizza (trust me, with selections like prosciutto and goat cheese, this are anything but ordinary). No matter what you do, save room for dessert. These are the most beautiful desserts that you have ever seen, and they taste even better. Whether you get one of the gorgeous macaroons or the salted butterscotch pudding, you will be more than happy with your choice. This place rocks, has good prices and with the enormous windows, white brick walls and larger than life fireplace, it will impress anyone you bring here. Guaranteed amazing meal.
user.name: Whitney Thompson

snippet:
Enjoyed the atmosphere. The Egg Benedict was great, the chicken sandwich was delightful and the desserts (tiramisu, lemon tart and others) were excellent.
This was my second time coming and im never disappointed. The waiter was very professional  and the food came out timely.
user.name: odessa johnson

snippet: Absolutely amazing place for dining and atmosphere. My boyfriend and I had an incredible date night here as tourists from outside LA and our server David was remarkable! He was there for any questions, gave awesome recommendations, and had a very friendly attitude the entire time. Thank you David! Food is delicious with large portion sizes. The chicken parmesan (recommended by David) was the best I've had, and the dessert menu was so hard to choose from. Exceptional food and service.

snippet: The food is decent but the price is ridiculous.  The best way to put it, it's like Denny's with better  presentation.  The environment is loud and the wait was long.  The pastry section has good selection but again, ridiculous price.  Parking is available in the paid parking structure or out on the street. Not worth the hype.

snippet: Beautiful desserts...Great menu

snippet: I am not a fan of the restaurant but the bakery has some of the best desserts I've had in the immediate 5 mile radius. The desserts are expensive and a bit small but pretty decadent. Will not say my favorite because I don't want them to run out of it when I visit.

snippet: Amazing service, delicious brunch. Outstanding desserts!
user.name: Sriram Ranga

snippet: One of my favorite spots downtown. The dessert menu is insane. I love the macaroons. It's super loud, which makes conversations difficult to have, but it's a part of the ambience. No reservations. Just show up 20-45 minutes before your desired meal time to get your name on the list. Luckily they have a text system that will alert you when your table is ready so feel free to head somewhere else for drinks while you wait for your table to be available.

snippet: Acoustics are loud and echo because it used to be a bank. The food is amazing here. Service is great and fast. Sunday brunch is amazing. They don't take reservations but don't let the crowd scare you. They seat people quickly and usually under the estimated time.

snippet: Great pastries.  Beautiful display.  Courteous staff.
user.name: James Helm

snippet: Lovely place, good service, nice food
user.name: Christy Hong

snippet: Great authentic french pastry,  must try their beignet whoch is not easy to find in LA

snippet: Very busy and expect long wait. $8 valet parking.
user.name: michael louie

snippet: We had their crispy potatoes (so good no ketchup needed) and avacado toast for appetizers. Both were delicious and had their margarita Pizza for our main entree. The crust on the pizza was perfect, chewy but light and crispy, can't wait to go back. We also had their fruit tart for dessert. It was light and fresh from the fruit and the custard was balanced, not overly sweet but just enough to compliment the fruit. The staff was very well informed and happy to answer any questions we had. Great experience and hope to return soon.

snippet: This is a very fancy place. Their products are beautifully crafted and presented. The staff is knowledgeable and helpful. We liked what we got but it wasn't good enough to justify the ridiculous price tag. Charging >$12 for tarts seems a little excessive to me when the items were not significantly better than similar ones at other bakeries that are more reasonably priced. Maybe they are going after a different clientele.

snippet: My Airbnb host recommended this spot and I'm so glad she did. It was very near to her home and so packed when my girls and I arrived, but we got a seat immediately. Our waiter was very polite and informative with recommendations exceeding the restaurant. I will always remember this location and return in the future for sure to try something new each visit.
user.name: D√©j√† Wilson

snippet: Love the food, especially the portobello mushroom fries.
user.name: Yuehling Chiu

snippet: Bustling hip restaurant serving classic Italian dishes and pricey.
user.name: VJ

snippet: Great restaurant. The pizza is obviously very well done. I had the lamb chops and they were perfect, the best I've had. Their drinks were also amazing, and the staff extremely nice. Do to the open design the place is very loud but overall a great experience.
user.name: William Hurt

snippet: Pizza is very good and so are the drinks.
user.name: adrian leon

snippet:
A biz review is subjective to the day, time and experience of our visit. I don't like bad reviews but hopefully important to the business owner (if they care) to take them into consideration.

My friend and I both placed our order with a quite pleasant waitress (that's a plus). After about 20 minutes my friend got served his order while mine arrived 20 minutes after he finished his meal. Really...40 minutes wait for a Steak Salad! that I ate alone. Defeats the purpose of enjoying a meal together with a friend.

I wouldn't have minded so much the wait if the meal had made up for it. The spinach salad was swimming into the dressing, the steak not tasty at all. Not sure that I'll go there again on a Sunday or any other day. Also too much noisy food court ambiance.

They have a large pastry, chocolate section by the entrance which I haven't tried. Maybe good, maybe bad I'll never find out.
user.name: Yatara V

snippet: Very good food in down town Los Angeles. Good for groups or couples. Great service. It's a sizable restaurant and surprisingly very well ran. Space is cavernous and white so it has a very festive atmosphere. Excellent pizzas and drinks. Delicious cocktails. Parking validated you get $2 off when you park accros the street.
user.name: Mikhail Sverdlov

snippet: I love the desserts in this spot. The atmosphere is really easy going and love going there. The staff is in the mood every time. You have a big choice of food and drink but still my favorite is the desserts there. Maybe the best I have had in the city. Love you and see you soon
user.name: Alicia Reeves

snippet:
It has a bakery, full bar and a restaurant inside the same complex. I went to the restaurant.

Food: I would rate it 4 out of 5. Everything was delicious but nothing extraordinary.

Ambience: 1 out of 5. It was too loud. It was impossible to order food without literally screaming out your order to your waiter who is standing next to you.

Wait time: I think it depends on when you go. We went at 6:30pm for an early dinner and didn't have to wait. But they don't take reservations by phone for a party of less than 12.

Variety: They serve Italian food. The menu as well as food is pretty authentic. I kept drooling over the dessert section after dinner.
user.name: Vaneet Dadra

snippet: We enjoy going to Bottega Louie very much.  The pizza makes it worth our long drive.  Like they don‚Äôt take reservations.  We enjoy their cocktails & browsing the beautiful desserts while waiting.  Looking forward to new location opening soon.  We do wish it were not such a loud restaurant.
user.name: Pete Fisher

snippet: I have been coming here for about a year, and honestly it is one of the best places I've eaten in the area. The giant macarons are always great. The desserts are phenomenal. But the last time I went to have lunch with my daughter, service was slow and my food came out cold despite it not being busy. It was so cold that i thought I had received the wrong order. I had to use more than a fork to cut my ravioli. Will probably return though.

snippet: Came here for the Chocolate souffle and it did not disappoint. First, it's huge. Big enough to split with someone else. Texture, flavor and sweetness were spot on. The Creme Anglaise was perfectly made, good texture and perfect thickness without an eggie flavor. I would've preferred the sauce to be a tad bit sweeter but that's just a personal preference. To be fair this is a Souffle review but I highly recommend it.

snippet: love the their pizza, not greasy. Lasagna was great as well

snippet: Had here a vanilla eclair. It was quite underwhelming for such a price. The dough was too dense, the filling was too sweet.

snippet: My friend introduced me to this place and I know I will be there again soon for lunch.
user.name: khemarakseima Renee

snippet: I thought I had been fine dining before, boy was I wrong. We had the seasonal tasting menu and for the next three hours we enjoyed the most delicious food I had ever tasted. I highly recommend doing the wine pairing! Great atmosphere, we will certainly be going back.
user.name: Peter Sanchez

snippet: I loved the shrimp scampi. Large shrimp was naturally sweet and juicy. The pork lasagna was incredible. Wonderful staff. The only thing, an added charge was on our bill for employees health coverage. To work around this I deducted this charge from the tip I would have given.

snippet: A very nice place to have breakfast, the atmosphere is simple and sophisticated, the staff is pleasant and friendly, our food was brought to our table quickly even though it seemed pretty busy inside the restaurant. The coffee was delicious and my omelette was cooked perfectly. Also the restroom was extremely clean. If you're looking for a nice upper-scale breakfast spot in downtown L.A. I recommend going to Bottega Louie.

snippet: Wonderful marriage of atmosphere and cuisine. The service is impeccable, and recommendations tend to satisfy even the pickiest palate.

snippet: This place is beautiful! It is a bit loud because of the high ceilings, but the food is amazing and the staff is extremely nice. A bit on the price side for food (entrees are between $25-$35), but worth a try. Get the macaroons after your meal for a tasty dessert.
user.name: Nicholas Clemens

snippet: One of the best croissants I have ever had
user.name: Raymond Soto

snippet: The place is too busy for personalized service.  We were a party of 6 and the waiter brought one person's entree with the appetizers. When we asked that he take the one entree back to keep it warm and serve it with the other 5 entrees when they came out, the response was that the food was coming soon and he declined to take it back.  As a result, one person had an entree 10 minutes before the others which was cold by the time the others arrived.
user.name: Doug Painter

snippet: I've got an interesting angle for a review. Sure, the food was great, but there was a strange phenomenon occurring as I was shoveling their delectable lasagna into my mouth or waiting on my chocolate souffle to arrive (not a one person dessert, plan accordingly). Over the course of an hour long meal, I saw no less than a half dozen of the waiters and staff hugging, fist bumping, clapping each other on the back, and generally being in good spirits. It was bizarre, but obviously in a good way. It was almost like one of them had come back from a long trip or vacation and was back for their first night (who knows, that may have been the case). The staff was showing a level of positive morale that I'm not accustomed to seeing at a restaurant, and that likely brings up the entire experience.
user.name: Stephen Machuga (Shanghai Six)

snippet:
We entered te restaurant for breakfast right before 11 o‚Äôclock we got a table and the menu.
3 minutes later they came back and literally took the menu out of our hands saying it was one minute after 11 now and the lunch was starting so we could‚Äônt order any eggs or breakfast menu anymore. While we where sitting next to the kitchen we could see the chef was still making eggs but that didn‚Äôt matter. The service we got was super unfriendly and we decided to leave.
user.name: Charis Buchinhoren

snippet:
I was introduced by my girlfriend to try it out because she saw it in a blog and only heard good things about it.

I believe this place does deserve the 5 star rating but at the time of my visit, it did not. As established as the place is, you'd expect to be serviced right when you walk in. However we stood there idly as servers continue to chat within themselves. Another server saw our awkward situation and proceeded to get the attention of someone to assist us with our seats. Finally we were seated by the hostess who may have returned from the bathroom.

We ordered the truffle pizza, clam linguine and portabello fries under the waiter's recommendation. $25 each dish and the fries were about $10. The fries were wonderful and such a new experience for my mouth. I was going to order regular fries but I am glad I didn't! It was so delicious. The other dishes were great too but I thought the linguine was a bit plain. However I noticed how generous they were with the seafood as other restaurants would only give a few pieces. Some clams remain in their shells and others were plucked out already to be centered in the dish. The pizza's cheese was to be admired and you could smell the truffle right away.

The portion was actually too much for just the two of us. One of the dish with an appetizer would have been enough. We noticed other couples ordered light like salad, they must have experience.

The experience was pleasant and we went to the pastry side to admire the gift basket options and macaroons. They all looked like art and delicious. We tried two of the macaroons, earl grey and dark chocolate ganache.

We will definitely revisit in the future.
user.name: Andrew Feng

snippet: I go here multiple times a week, because all food and drinks are delicious and fresh, the staff is friendly and efficient, the atmosphere is warm and quiet enough for working but fun enough for hanging out.  Even when it seems busy, my order comes out quickly, and there is ample seating, so I've never had to turn around and leave for that reason.  The prices are beyond reasonable for the quality.  Also, you get Perka points for your order now.  I would recommend it to anyone!
user.name: Robert Wallace

snippet: I've eaten here twice. The food was pretty good and the menu decent. I liked their wood fired pizza. I also came to buy a friend a pastry and was kind of put off by the prices. $15 for a tiny single serving cake? Must be good. I went with the $8 √©clair instead.
user.name: Cort Chase

snippet: Great restaurant for all 3 meals!!!! High end setting with interesting menu choices for all meals. Pizza is surprisingly good. Ask for bread as its tremendous. Haven‚Äôt gotten a bad entree here. To top it off get some excellent pricey bakery goods to go
user.name: Humfrid Eastone

snippet: Great food! Can be kind of loud. Desserts were so worth the wait!
user.name: Kris Katagiri

snippet:
This place is beautiful and the food is delish. The Pancakes are great with a slight lemon taste and their egg Benedict is cooked perfectly.

Skip the mimosa's if you're going for brunch. They're a crazy $12. Which was the cost of most everything on their brunch menu. I took a star off for that ridiculous price.
user.name: Kendra Vander Vliet

snippet: Truly an unforgettable experience. We had Breakfast. Ordered food to go: meatballs, pizza and especially macorons. We will be back when we are in LA.
user.name: Janet Barr

snippet:
After we were seated I asked our server about the beer on tap. I told him that I only heard the first two beers while we were waiting at the bar. He asked if I wanted to order one of the two rather than telling me about the other 2 beers 1. He didnt know the four beers they offered 2. He walked away obviously annoyed to go find out the other two beers. 3. He told me the beer I ordered was a white ale when it was a witbeir.
After our drinks arrived he came up to us every thirty second after we asked him for some time to decide, all while complaining to us, the customers about how busy they were. We ordered our food and ended up waiting over an hour for our food when our server asked us if we were ready to order and we were left speechless. He said he lost our ticket, then said he found it, but had already put in the order. Our table next to us recieved their food before us, and we had been sitting there for an hour. After we had finally got our food our server kept rushing us out. Basically ripping plates off of our table and leaving us with ONE PLATE after I told him we were going to have another slice of pizza. What really upset me was when he forced me to eat the last peice of pasta off the plate so he could take it off our table. This was 30 minutes into our meal after waiting a hour after we had ordered. It gets better, he brings us our bill while we were still enjoying our meal and brings us a to-go box. At this point I wouldn't have been surprised if he put me in a headlock and threw me out. The food was great but the service was unforgivable. Its a shame that a beautiful restraunt with good food has to be spoiled with horrible service. Invest in some front of house training, please.
user.name: David Pak

snippet:
I had a good dinner here and the service was great. The reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because of what happened after when I went to the counter to get a dessert to go. I selected the dessert I wanted and they boxed it up for me. As I was paying I saw them throwing away the same dessert I just bought along with everything else in the display.

Come on wait until the customer has left! It cheapens the experience completely and makes me feel like my dessert is trash like the rest of them that went in the garbage. Do what you want with them when no one's looking, but not in front of the customer that just paid $14 for a dessert that was thrown in the trash with a ton of other perfectly edible desserts.
user.name: John Primrose

snippet: Fantastic brunch menu with absolutely amazing desserts. Pricey but worth a visit. Service is ok they may be a tad slow because of staffing but they make an honest effort. I recommend the lobster hash.
user.name: steven mendez

snippet: Had a very enjoyable late night dinner on Saturday. The hostess staff was pleasant and greeted and seated me promptly. My waitress Brooke was fantastic, she suggested both a special (Burrata Salad) and a popular dish (Portobello Fries) and I was pleased with both in addition to my Artichoke Pizza and wine. Although it was quite a lot of food for one person, everything was spot on flavor wise and I was easily able to take my leftover pizza with me. Overall a good experience. Will be back soon.
user.name: Kora Hyde

snippet:
If you visit LA and your hotel is in downtown stop by this place is very good.
I first visit this restaurant 10 years ago and we decided to celebrate my wife's birthday last Saturday, the restaurant is only better.
We ordered a beet salad, and grilled octopus as small plates to share, they were incredible good but the highlight of the night was the Tartufo Pizza, just amazing, great flavor, a definite must of are here for dinner. We had a cocktail called Japanese mule which was good and strong, and a chocolate souffle for desert. The whole dinner was incredible we had a great time and we highly recommend this restaurant, of course on your way out you need to get macaroons, super tasty, go to Bottega Louie you will not regret it!
user.name: Octavio Guerrero

snippet: True Italian food, fresh beautiful ingredients simply prepared and elegantly served. Enjoyed an amazing post Museum launch with my wife and will definitely be back. The service team is delightful and quite beautiful. The restaurant is an elegant setting for a great meal.
user.name: KENN Israel

snippet: Enjoyed going here after dinner for a spot of tea and dessert. Their macaroons are absolutely delicious. We tried 12 different flavors and there are still more to try. Would definitely recommend others to try. Nice ambiance as well.
user.name: LeAnn Christy

snippet: Lovely little place! As other reviews mention, half is take-out, and half is a sit-down cafe. Brunch was a delight, delicious (if slightly pricey) food, very kind staff, and prompt service. The take-out side is a little hectic, however. The system for selecting and ordering macarons (which are amazing, by the way) could really use some streamlining. Perhaps they're understaffed?
user.name: Richard H. Gadsden

snippet: Reading some of the less favorable reviews of this place cracks me up. Place is awesome. On a brief 4 day trip here with my wife (who is a huge foodie) we ended up eating here three times because we loved it so much. If you don't like busy, popular spots I get it. But this place is busy... Because it's terrific and a lot of people know it.
user.name: Lew Baker

snippet:
The bakery selection is a work of art! Tried the macaroons and a princess cake and they were excellent.

I also had breakfast (the Eggs Benedict) and it was delicious as well. Great cappuccino too.

Nice that it's open late and that the front area is grab and go.
user.name: Angie Wimberly

snippet:
Nice bustling restaurant with great service. The food is definitely on the larger end in terms of portion size and pretty good tasting too. Definitely would go back.

Don't miss the dessert cabinets, they're the prettiest collections I've seen. couldn't help but to buy a couple of boxes to take home.
user.name: Evelyn Wai

snippet: My ALL TIME favorite brunch spot! It can get a little loud in the dining hall, but it is one of the most gorgeous places in downtown LA with soaring ceilings and a Manhattan vibe. Make sure to buy some macaroons on the way out!
user.name: Staci Eddy

snippet: Definitely one of our favorite restaurants. Menu is diverse, something for everyone. Desserts and macaroons especially are phenomenal, must try the earl grey macaron! Atmosphere is pleasant but it gets super busy, the turn around is swift but something to consider.
user.name: Breanna Campbell

snippet: I was very happy for the return of BL to downtown LA after almost 2 years them being closed. My excitement quickly changed however after my wife and I were discriminated upon by a new host who was to seat us. (The white male with the foreign accent). Just know he is solely responsible for us never wanting to return to your establishment ever again.
user.name: Pat A

snippet: Clearly the volume of reviews speaks for itself.  Bottega Louie being one of my all time favorite brunch cafe and dessert bar place (anywhere!), I had to share my love for this place.  It reminds me of a lot of cute boutique cafes in Italy/ France.  The ambiance is beautiful and EVERYTHING is beautifully made and presented.  Style of cooking and dishes are simply creative, modern and all around YUMMY!  There is not a single item on the brunch menu that is not out of this world.  Whatever your dessert of choice is, this place will meet and exceed your expectations.  This place is not popular and loved for no reason!
user.name: Nahla NNEW

snippet:
Best brunch!!
Please try salmon Benedict.
We visited on Sunday brunch and wait around 25min. But it was worth for waiting.
Our server did great service and made us happy.
If you want to get chocolate souffle, please order it with your main menu. It takes around 20min to prepare.
user.name: Hyunwoo Cho

snippet:
Location is excellent.  At first entrance you see patisserie strewn with marble and gold.  And the prices also reflect this.
Upon sampling some of the pastry I felt somewhat let down.  The flavors did not honor the history of  French patisserie as one would hope.
Service was on point and even with $$$$ prices I would revisit.
user.name: Ezekiel

snippet: Great take on classic Italian dishes. But, the price tag does not match the flavor. This is not meant to undermine the taste and quality of the food, but highlight the high prices. What earns this place 5 instead of 4 stars are the fantastic waiters and the light and wonderful atmosphere.
user.name: Elias West

snippet: If you‚Äôre looking for the best Caesar Salad around, this place has it. Their food, drinks, dessert, ambiance and service is amazing. No notes üëåüèΩ

snippet: Went here last night for dinner. I always get the portobello fries and lasagna. Also, the beignets  with the raspberry sauce on the side are soooo good. I love the structure of the restaurant, very high ceilings with very minimal of anything else. Very clean look. Can sometimes be hard to hear others, but I still love it. Had Jameson for our waiter.
