user.name: Karl Ross

snippet: This resturaunt is very good. It‚Äôs very clean, fancy, and the workers are very nice! The workers always have a smile on there face! And, the food is VERY good. Probably the best food ever! It‚Äôs good quality and they‚Äôll always make requests! Such as, ‚ÄúWould you like any cheese?‚Äù or ‚ÄúWould you like me to drizzle the egg yolk on your pizza?‚Äù PLEASE GO TO THIS RESTURAUNT
user.name: Jianna Rae

snippet: LA prices as expected.  Service could have been better.  But the food was excellent.  I had the linguine and clams and my girlfriend had the chicken Parmesan.  Both dishes some of the best Italian we have had.  I‚Äôm from Philly so that doesn‚Äôt come easy with me.  Good house wine but overpriced.  Overall worth a stop if your in LA.
user.name: Sam

snippet:
Had a bit of a wait but it was well worth it. The prices were a bit higher than other restaurants in DTLA. This high ceiling gourmet restaurant was just right for a special evening with my girlfriend even though it was a bit crowded, with tables very close together almost like eating in a gymnasium ;-) The salads and entrees where good though.
Even though they were busy our Waiter was on point.  BTW, they make excellent pizza!
user.name: Tim Remmings

snippet: The restaurant has great service and amazing staff. The atmosphere of the restaurant can seem chaotic as it can get very loud with over 200+ people being served in the same big dining area. The food is great but not as great as it has been hyped up to be. The dessert selection is where this place shines, with everything looking like a work of art.

snippet: OMG! This place is dessert land on steroids!  I'm not complaining; just wish I lived in L.A. so I could go there every week! My experience there was superb and I wouldn't change a thing!  Great food; good service; good prices; and did I say fabulous desserts.  I had them pack extra desserts so I could bring back to Seattle with me. I wish they would come to Seattle!
user.name: agent4you2

snippet: My husband and I make it a point to come here every time we're in DTLA visiting our daughter. We love everything about this place. The high energy buzz, the decently fast seating, and the beautiful and qualified staff make for an enjoyable time. The dinner and wine menu is just right for us as our palate's are rather particular. The pricing is fair and reasonable based on the quality of service and food. There is a bakery retail section where the sweets are almost too beautiful to eat! We always remember to pick up a few beautifully packaged gifts to take with before heading back to our home in Arizona.

snippet: Good food (minus the steak and fries), excellent pizza, good service, no parking whatsoever, valet is available. Honestly, I prefer their dessert and coffee which has to be sent back at least twice, since their machine doesn't really make it hot. But they get it right eventually.

snippet: Raspberry ‚Äúfilled‚Äù beignet. The amount of filling was practically non existent. Would not recommend.
user.name: Ren Robinson

snippet: The best souffl√© pancake I have ever had in my life! The smoked salmon Benedict was just outstanding as well!
user.name: Paula Bohbot

user.name: Melody_mm

snippet: Best place to eat deserts and pastries. I love the macaroons here, by far the best I have ever had. The price will seem steep but the quality and taste is definitely there. I was in town for a week and came back 4 times.

snippet: Stopped in to have appetizers on a Monday night. The building is gorgeous and the desserts on display were beautiful. Portabello fries, avocado and chorizo dip, and the mac and cheese were all phenomenal. We sat in the casual dining area - nice bar space.
user.name: Lisset Nev√°rez

snippet:
Pricey, but you can definitely taste the quality.

Let me just say, the inside of the restaurant is gorgeous! Very spacious and plenty of seating is available at the location. I've only visited during lunch time, which isn't as busy compared to dinner, but if you're able to book a reservation just do it.

Once you get in line to order pastries or macarons,  definitely be prepared to order and know what you want. The ordering line moves extremely fast.

They have a nice selection of macaron flavors and they're constantly making fresh batches. Pricing is pretty reasonable. As far as the pastries go, they are on the pricey side, but you can definitely taste the quality of ingredients that go into the items. They also have chocolates and freshly baked bread towards the back. If you're looking to pick up a quick gift, they have boxed gift items like chocolates or meringue roses available.
user.name: Stephanie

snippet:
No reservations needed. Service is excellent in this very bustling place. Try one of the mixed drinks ..good selections
We had chicken parm, bruschetta, pizza, Modena salad and all we're generous servings and delivered hot. They were delicious. While they have an excellent bakery we were pressed for time. This is a fun, delicious spot in LA although not a romantic night out
user.name: Sandra Geniesse

snippet: Best place for an early morning brunch date. Easy paid parking near by. Larger groups can be a bit harder for seating if you come later in the morning. The atmosphere, decor and food are all top notch. I highly recommend their smoked salmon or avacado toast!
user.name: Alex

snippet:
Bottega Louie looks and feels like a restaurant featured in Sex in the City or Entourage.  It is extremely classy and clean.  The restaurant itself is huge and feels even bigger with the high ceilings and open space.  The prices are surprisingly affordable (entrees around $20), especially considering the quality of the food and the amazing service.

My wife and I went to Louie for a weekend brunch.  We stood in line before it opened and it was well worth the wait.  The lobster hash can wow most any diner.  The portobello fries, however, impressed me the most.  The batter is extremely light and perfectly fried, providing a great crunch while preserving a juicy mushroom inside.  I will return for the fries if nothing else.  They are that good!

The restaurant also has an extensive bakery.  We are not into sweets, but if you are, it looks like Louie is top notch.

ALL-STAR DISH: portobello fries.
user.name: Kyle Koichi Morishita

snippet:
Well I have to say that the place which was located in Downtown LA was quite a large and loud place to dine. We did not anticipate that one could not have a conversation at a table with 8 people , across the table.  The food was ok but not over the top and anything to write  home about.
I am sure that overall people enjoy the atmosphere  and ambiance but it is for sheer entertainment and not business.  Enjoy and
user.name: Barry

snippet:
If you ever felt like getting flavors exploding in your mouth while looking at desserts, you've come to the right place!

This place is always hectic. It's always a rush in here, but the food is fantastic. LA has always been a great place to get virtually any sort of food you're looking for, but this is the place where you can really sink your teeth into some good food. I recommend the pizzas. If you're not on a diet, binge on desserts here. they're great.

If you're on a diet and it's not cheat day, stay the hell out of here. You won't leave without sugar in your stomach.

snippet: Great service, delicious food, and pleasant experience! Enjoyed the Salmon Benedict and Riocotta Blueberry Lemon Pancakes washing it all down with a couple of ginger ales. The bakery, pastry casing, and gift were a perfect treat for all hearts. Cupcakes and macoron are a new found favorite. Impressed with the prices, and love that the prices are showcased in the online menu. Thank you for the wonderful experience!
user.name: R. A. Rodriguez

snippet: We've been here at least ten times and we try to order different things on the menu each time. Honestly, we've never been disappointed. The food is really flavorful and there is a good diversity of choices. Just slightly expensive but overall quite reasonable. The place is famous for its macaron bakery and display. This is a great place to take people visiting Los Angeles - something about the vibe just resonates with people and I've never met anyone that did not enjoy the food and experience. It's also a great place to get dinner and then walk or ride-share up to the Ahmanson or Disney Concert Hall afterwards. Easily my favorite place to get food in downtown.
user.name: Kyle Tacsik

snippet: Awesome place, great interior and design. The food was top notch, the burrata pizza was incredible and highly recommended for those who go. Good size menu with various items to choose from and the pastry deli is to die for.

snippet: This place is much bigger than I thought. Restaurant is separated in 2 sections, dessert and fine dining table service. There is a large selection of treats and a pretty good selection for dinner. Make sure you go here at night, it's not as crowded and low light setting makes for a perfect date.

snippet: I am not sure that everyone has enjoyed the fantastic food served in the glorious space downtown known as Bottega Louie.  If not, you owe it to yourself to try it at least once.  Be warned that parking is not easy!  Service is excellent and do not, of course, forget dessert.  A Los Angeles classic.... Highly recommend!

snippet: My wife and I eat at Bottega Louie whenever we are downtown. The food and the service are excellent and the prices are average for an upscale, but casual restaurant. The atmosphere is loud, but to be expected given the size of the dining area and the fact the the restaurant has very high ceilings and walls that have no insulation to absorb echoing sounds. With that said, we think it adds to the ambiance and the experience. This is a restaurant that is definitely worth visiting.

snippet:
Exceptional quality! The food was so good. I ordered the Lobster hash, and noticed they added one Brussels sprout that was filled with flavor. I like to cook from time to time, but never thought of something so subtle adding to the dish, just excellent! My girlfriend ordered the french toast, which was also made perfectly - soft with great taste!

Attention to detail! The servers took down my last name, and then walked up to me after 10 minutes, even though there was several people waiting, they remembered who I was. We also used their free wi-fi, and received an email thanking us for our visit. I've never been to a restaurant that was so exceptional at little things. Definitely going back A+ in my book.

snippet:
When I was here, the food was inedible. Whatever fried balls in sauce we had ordered were fried to a charcoal crisp and covered in an intensely flavored, and terribly paired, thick dark sauce, which LITERALLY, had the balls floating on it because they were insanely overly saturated.

Then some waiter walks by with a plate of dirty dishes, covered in other people's pieces of food. As we sat there dissecting our food, this server put those dirty dishes, from some other table, and put them on our table while we were trying to eat. He walked off for a minute, then came back for the plates and walked away. We sat there horrified.

At the end of the most disgusting and inedible meal I've ever had prepared for me, we tried 3 times to get a hold of a manger. Nobody came to our table so we just left, feeling shocked and pretty enraged. Although it was a little humorous, because I've never had such a terrible experience at a restaurant. It was like a bad comedy.

Shame cause the pastry case looked cute.

snippet: Great loud atmosphere! You feel like you're in a honeycomb with million other people. Not recommended for those looking for a romantic quiet date unless you don't mind the noise. Service is excellent. The waiter checked on us regularly. Not to the point where it was suffocating but to where he deserved a good tip. The food was great. We tried the palmero fries, fried calamaries, and steak with apple sauce and grilled vegetables. Price wise: $$$/$$$$$ but you do get was you pay for. Decor was lacking: the walls were bare but it is possible that they were renovating. Downtown LA is sorta sketch so the restaurant's location is kind of odd but we felt safe and had a great time.
